document.title: Career and Technology Education Standards template

AB93A8921FCF450AADA0A457E5B36B4F.description:
Apply
principles of inventory
management, labor cost
and control techniques,
production planning and
control, sustainability,
and facilities
management to planning.

EDD36D92E131417C820218C701F9813B.description:
Design
internal and external
crisis management and
disaster plans and
response procedures.

82D39E3F2BE0400FB3E46C06533344CA.description:
Conduct
staff orientation, initial
training, and education;
consistent reinforcement
of training principles,
standards, and education;
and on-the-job training or
retraining.

659860643BA54CD4BE371DBF13585329.description:

the procedures involved
in staff planning,
recruiting, interviewing,
selecting, scheduling,

and terminating of
employees.

610B53A29C9D4FED8EC7DE9C5E2479A0.description:

compensation, overtime,

C90E7E90EE4C486888E0C76EA2593E1C.description:

specific events on

703BFEBD3F6C423E98DAC0BEFD9EE980.description:

specific age groups or
diverse populations.

6DFF77EF4783497BB4E01BB174BAFA0D.description:

presentation.

359E89B5822B40AB873943C150C03A2D.description:

CCA31EBD069B4C7A93BC4A24D892C5BB.description:

event.

EFBE9A63388C41839353C1F68481BBB7.description:

524B00B3040D41E5979FC4C414F3B4A8.description:
Explore
wellness through
recreation and leisure
programs and events.

E39C1ECD9563465D9950D8140F57129B.description:

organizations and agencies
and their impact on
hospitality, lodging, travel,
and recreation operations.

C00E2DDA21F944B8998BFB9E080FB890.description:

management practices and skills
involved in hospitality, lodging,

0A5E9EE10B954502AABDB950F8539EC5.description:

23FA6C066C684A4F9F3922629014C585.description:

56B5931E5A6B44179F2897C7B1EBAA0A.description:

climate, sites, time zones,
and political and global
influences of various

D070730F9B9543079691429D5369B874.description:

use, care, storage,

tools, and supplies.

events.

6767FFC8285C488786D3CF6DEC16BDA3.description:

CE7C677FBA4045D081A083A39BEEA4DF.description:

potential needs of domestic
and international travelers.

B3B9A3D3613346629B148F723E1E8B7A.description:

9587090AA6BF4072BA14CA719742CE60.description:

travel.

sales and marketing

cash handling, accounting,
and financial transactions.

BDEB1EB8EAF94F1ABF24230E5FE4401F.description:

practices and skills involved in
hospitality, lodging, travel, and
recreation-related services.

1072FFDCF20944598EF4EF24F0559E36.description:

414B4533F7624F4BBD91F07D565E9573.description:

as a strategic component

performance.

93C8BA5AA36743CEB21FA9E5F5AAE7A0.description:

strategies for addressing
and resolving complaints.

03421BCD696A4A78ACC2F8D95119343C.description:

592248BC8C8D4028B81E1A0BE84F906F.description:

3083868CCFD34E8B9F086A0026846A74.description:

communication strategies
used in interpersonal
relationships.

A8DABB7934804CA796E539A1CC1A887E.description:

expectations of customers
in a variety of settings.

0944A3CCCC494C629B7A860D6EA8D1C2.description:

quality service to assure customer
satisfaction in lodging, travel,
recreation, and event planning

3874CF22788549EBB00E3519A740FDEA.description:

and environmental issues.

526267797ECA492CB55E16A767C999F2.description:

emergency procedures.

8302237803BC4E8494FDFD35230FA60F.description:

43370713BDC446179541B857F1481A02.description:

related to hospitality,
tourism, and recreation.

and conservation of

B45B4981310B4EF4B915DDC6F192644C.description:

emergency procedures.

8603C51A52BB4C68BB7DEAA9CD14C1DB.description:

Develop
evacuation plans and
emergency procedures.

00422B1DB83444C7B6F2FB8D5A8087DE.description:

related to hospitality,

58546913D1B641C2A92CA6A9F32CCEB4.description:

related to hospitality,

36772730D49B4553A571FFFF438C1E5E.description:

procedures applied to safety,

219612A2E03B44F19E1CC7269E852BD6.description:

Students will synthesize knowledge, skills, and practices required for careers in hospitality, tourism, and
